verses.roman:
ei-mata tina-vatsara śilā-mālā dharilā
tuṣṭa hañā śilā-mālā raghunāthe dilā

synonyms: ei-mata—in this way; tina-vatsara—for three years; śilā-mālā—the stone and the garland of conchshells; dharilā—He kept; tuṣṭa hañā—when He became very happy; śilā-mālā—the stone and the garland; raghunāthe—to Raghunātha dāsa; dilā—He delivered.
translation: For three years He kept the stone and garland. Then, greatly satisfied by the behavior of Raghunātha dāsa, the Lord delivered both of them to him.
